questions.question_text: Digital networking is configured between two Cisco Unity Connection clusters using an HTTPS connection. Which two objects are replicated between these two clusters? (Choose two.)

Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

Users connected to the internal network report a "Cannot communicate with the server" error while trying to log in to Cisco Jabber using auto service discovery.
The Jabber diagnostics and the SRV record configuration are as shown in the exhibit. The host cucm1.ccnp.cisco.com is correctly resolved by the user desktops with the Cisco Unified Communications Manager IP address. Why is the user not able to log in?

choices.A: SRV protocol is not set up correctly. It should be _tls instead of _tcp.
choices.C: The port specified on the SRV record is wrong.
choices.B: Marking weight as 0 on the SRV record makes it inactive, so Jabber cannot discover the Cisco Unified CM.
choices.D: The domain ccnp.cisco.com does not exist on the DNS server.

discussion.content:
The port specified on the SRV record is wrong. Port must be 8443.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/Windows/9_7/CJAB_BK_C606D8A9_00_cisco-jabber-dns-configuration-guide/CJAB_BK_C606D8A9_00_cisco-jabber-dns-configuration-guide_chapter_010.html

Selected Answer: C
Should be C
Answer is C it port should be 8443 not 8433
C is correct. port should be 8443

questions.question_text: To redirect calls from the phone extension for user A to the voicemail greeting, which call routing rule should be used in Cisco Unity Connection?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A Correct.
Attempt Forward Forwarded Rule - all calls from a user extension are routed to the user greeting
D. Opening Greeting forwarded routing rule

comments.content: further reading I feel A is correct

questions.question_text: An end user opened a ticket, stating that before logging in to Jabber for Windows, a warning is displayed that a server certificate has expired. Which two certificates must be verified on the Cisco Unified Communications Manager and IM&P deployment? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D for sure

I believe it's B and D as well.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-presence/116917-technote-certificate-00.html

https://community.cisco.com/t5/ip-telephony-and-phones/create-cue-user/td-p/610070

1. username userid [create | delete | fullname [first "first-name" | last "last-name" |

display "full-name"] | group group-name | language "language"| password "password" | pin number]1. username userid [create | delete | fullname [first "first-name" | last "last-name" |

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/unity_exp/rel7_1/administrator/AA_and_VM/3VMpara.html

1. config t

2. voice mailbox owner name [size seconds]

Answer A due to above syntax
